text: From: Paul, an apostle of the Messiah Jesus, by the command of God our Savior and the Messiah Jesus, our hope.
speaker: Narrator

text:
To: Timothy, my genuine child in the faith.
May grace, mercy, and peace from God the Father and the Messiah Jesus, our Lord, be yours!
speaker: Narrator

text: When I was on my way to Macedonia, I urged you to stay in Ephesus so that you could instruct certain people to stop teaching false doctrine
speaker: Narrator

text: and occupying themselves with myths and endless genealogies. These things promote controversies rather than God’s ongoing purpose, which involves faith.
speaker: Narrator

text: The goal of this instruction is love that flows from a pure heart, from a clear conscience, and from a sincere faith.
speaker: Narrator

text: Some people have left these qualities behind and have turned to fruitless discussion.
speaker: Narrator

text: They want to be teachers of the Law, yet they do not understand either what they are talking about or the things about which they speak so confidently.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of course, we know that the Law is good if a person uses it legitimately,
speaker: Narrator

text: that is, if he understands that the Law is not intended for righteous people but for lawbreakers and rebels, for ungodly people and sinners, for those who are unholy and irreverent, for those who kill their fathers, their mothers, or other people,
speaker: Narrator

text: for those involved in sexual immorality, for homosexuals, for kidnappers, for liars, for false witnesses, and for whatever else goes against the healthy teaching
speaker: Narrator

text: that agrees with the glorious gospel of the blessed God, which he entrusted to me.
speaker: Narrator

text: I thank the Messiah Jesus, our Lord, who gives me strength, that he has considered me faithful and has appointed me to his service.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the past I was a blasphemer, a persecutor, and a violent man. But I received mercy because I acted ignorantly in my unbelief,
speaker: Narrator

text: and the grace of our Lord overflowed toward me, along with the faith and love that are in the Messiah Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text:
This is a trustworthy saying that deserves complete acceptance:
To this world Messiah came,
    sinful people to reclaim.
I am the worst of them.
speaker: Narrator

text: But for that very reason I received mercy, so that in me, as the worst sinner, the Messiah Jesus might demonstrate all of his patience as an example for those who would believe in him for eternal life.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now to the King Eternal—the immortal, invisible, and only God—be honor and glory forever and ever! Amen.
speaker: Narrator

text: Timothy, my child, I am instructing you in keeping with the prophecies made earlier about you, so that by following them you may continue to fight the good fight
speaker: Narrator

text: with faith and a good conscience. By ignoring their consciences, some people have destroyed their faith like a wrecked ship.
speaker: Narrator

text: These include Hymenaeus and Alexander, whom I handed over to Satan so that they may learn not to blaspheme.
speaker: Narrator

text: First of all, then, I urge you to offer to God petitions, prayers, intercessions, and expressions of thanks for all people,
speaker: Narrator

text: for kings, and for everyone who has authority, so that we might lead a quiet and peaceful life with all godliness and dignity.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is good and acceptable in the sight of God our Savior,
speaker: Narrator

text: who wants all people to be saved and to come to know the truth fully.
speaker: Narrator

text: There is one God. There is also one mediator between God and human beings—a human, the Messiah Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: He gave himself as a ransom for everyone, the testimony at the proper time.
speaker: Narrator

text: For this reason I was appointed to be an announcer, an apostle, and a faithful and true teacher of the gentiles. (I am telling you the truth. I am not lying.)
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore, I want the men everywhere to pray, lifting up holy hands without being angry or argumentative.
speaker: Narrator

text: Women, for their part, should display their beauty by dressing modestly and decently in appropriate clothes, not with elaborate hairstyles or by wearing gold, pearls, or expensive clothes,
speaker: Narrator

text: but through good actions. This is proper for women who claim to revere God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let a woman learn with a quiet spirit, and submissively.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover, in the area of teaching, I am not allowing a woman to instigate conflict toward a man. Instead, she is to remain calm.
speaker: Narrator

text: For Adam was formed first, then Eve,
speaker: Narrator

text: and it was not Adam who was deceived. It was the woman who was deceived and became disobedient,
speaker: Narrator

text: even though she will be saved through the birth of the Child, if they continue in faith, love, and holiness, along with good judgment.
speaker: Narrator

text:
This is a trustworthy saying:
The one who would an elder be,
a noble task desires he.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore, an elder must be blameless, the husband of one wife, stable, sensible, respectable, hospitable to strangers, and teachable.
speaker: Narrator

text: He must not drink excessively or be a violent person, but instead be gentle. He must not be argumentative or love money.
speaker: Narrator

text: He must manage his own family well and have children who are submissive and respectful in every way.
speaker: Narrator

text: For if a man does not know how to manage his own family, how can he take care of God’s church?
speaker: Narrator

text: He must not be a recent convert, so that he won’t become arrogant and fall into the Devil’s condemnation.
speaker: Narrator

text: He must be well thought of by outsiders, so he doesn’t fall into disgrace and the trap set for him by the Devil.
speaker: Narrator

text: Deacons, too, must be serious. They must not be two-faced, addicted to wine, or greedy for money.
speaker: Narrator

text: They must hold firmly to the secret of the faith with clear consciences.
speaker: Narrator

text: But they must first be tested. Then, if they prove to be blameless, let them serve in ministry.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their wives must also be serious. They must not be gossips, but instead be stable and trustworthy in everything.
speaker: Narrator

text: Deacons must be husbands of one wife and must manage their children and their families well.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those who serve well in ministry gain an excellent reputation for themselves and will have great assurance by their faith in the Messiah Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: I hope to come to you soon. However, I’m writing this to you
speaker: Narrator

text: in case I am delayed, so that you may know how to behave in God’s household, which is the church of the living God, the pillar and foundation of the truth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
By common confession, the secret of our godly worship is great:
In flesh was he revealed to sight,
    vindicated by the Spirit’s might,
        adored by angels singing.
To nations was he manifest,
    believing souls found peace and rest,
        our Lord in heaven reigning!
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the Spirit says clearly that in the last times some people will abandon the faith by following deceitful spirits, the teachings of demons,
speaker: Narrator

text: and the hypocrisy of liars, whose consciences have been burned by a hot iron.
speaker: Narrator

text: They will try to stop people from marrying and from eating certain foods, which God created to be received with thanksgiving by those who believe and know the truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: For everything God created is good, and nothing should be rejected if it is received with thanksgiving,
speaker: Narrator

text: because it is sanctified by the word of God and prayer.
speaker: Narrator

text: If you continue to point these things out to the brothers, you will be a good servant of the Messiah Jesus, nourished by the words of the faith and the healthy teaching that you have followed closely.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not have anything to do with godless myths and fables of old women. Instead, train yourself to be godly.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Physical exercise is of limited value, but
Godliness is very dear,
    a pledge of life, both there and here.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is a trustworthy saying that deserves complete acceptance.
speaker: Narrator

text: To this end we work hard and struggle, because we have set our hope on the living God, who is the Savior of all people, that is, of those who believe.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the things you must insist on and teach.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not let anyone look down on you because you are young, but be an example for other believers in your speech, behavior, love, faithfulness, and purity.
speaker: Narrator

text: Until I arrive, give your full concentration to the public reading of Scripture, to exhorting, and to teaching.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not neglect the gift that is in you, which was given to you through prophecy when the elders laid their hands on you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Think on these things. Devote your life to them so that everyone can see your progress.
speaker: Narrator

text: Pay close attention to your life and your teaching. Persevere in these things, because if you do so, you will save both yourself and those who listen to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Never speak harshly to an older man, but appeal to him as if he were your father. Treat younger men like brothers,
speaker: Narrator

text: older women like mothers, and younger women like sisters, with absolute purity.
speaker: Narrator

text: Honor widows who have no other family members to care for them.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if a widow has children or grandchildren, they must first learn to respect their own family by repaying their parents, for this is pleasing in God’s sight.
speaker: Narrator

text: A woman who has no other family members to care for her and who is left all alone has placed her hope in God and devotes herself to petitions and prayers night and day.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the self-indulgent widow is just as good as dead.
speaker: Narrator

text: Continue to give these instructions, so that they may be blameless.
speaker: Narrator

text: If anyone does not take care of his own relatives, especially his immediate family, he has denied the faith and is worse than an unbeliever.
speaker: Narrator

text: A widow may be put on the widows’ list if she is at least sixty years old and has been the wife of one husband.
speaker: Narrator

text: She must be well known for her good actions as a woman who has raised children, welcomed strangers, washed the saints’ feet, helped the suffering, and devoted herself to doing good in every way.
speaker: Narrator

text: But do not include younger widows on your list. For whenever their natural desires cause them to lose their devotion to the Messiah, they want to remarry.
speaker: Narrator

text: They receive condemnation because they have set aside their prior commitment to the Messiah.
speaker: Narrator

text: At the same time, they also learn how to be lazy while going from house to house. Not only this, but they even become gossips and keep busy by interfering in other people’s lives, saying things they should not say.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore, I want younger widows to remarry, have children, manage their homes, and not give the enemy any chance to ridicule them.
speaker: Narrator

text: For some widows have already turned away to follow Satan.
speaker: Narrator

text: If any woman is a believer and has relatives who are widows, she should help them. The church should not be burdened, so it can help those widows who have no other family members to care for them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Elders who handle their duties well should be considered worthy of double compensation, especially those who work hard at preaching and teaching.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Scripture says, “You must not muzzle an ox while it is treading out grain,” and, “A worker deserves his pay.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not accept an accusation against an elder unless it is supported “by two or three witnesses.”
speaker: Narrator

text: As for those who keep on sinning, rebuke them in front of everyone so that the rest will also be afraid.
speaker: Narrator

text: With God as my witness, as well as the Messiah Jesus and the chosen angels, I solemnly call on you to carry out these instructions without prejudice, doing nothing on the basis of partiality.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not ordain anyone hastily. Do not participate in the sins of others. Keep yourself pure.
speaker: Narrator

text: Stop drinking only water, but use a little wine for your stomach because of your frequent illnesses.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sins of some people are obvious, leading them to judgment. The sins of others follow them there.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the same way, good actions are obvious, and those that are not cannot remain hidden.
speaker: Narrator

text: All who are under the yoke of slavery should regard their own masters as deserving of the highest respect, so that the name of God and our teaching may not be discredited.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover, those who have believing masters should be respectful to them, because they are fellow believers. In fact, they must serve them even better, because those who benefit from their service are believers and dear to them. These are the things you must teach and exhort.
speaker: Narrator

text: If anyone teaches false doctrine and refuses to agree with the sound words of our Lord Jesus, the Messiah, and godly teaching,
speaker: Narrator

text: he is a conceited person and does not understand anything. He has an unhealthy craving for arguments and debates. This produces jealousy, rivalry, slander, evil suspicions,
speaker: Narrator

text: and incessant conflict between people who are depraved in mind and deprived of truth. They think that godliness is a way to make a profit.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of course, godliness with contentment does bring a great profit.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Nothing to this world we bring;
    from it take we nothing.
speaker: Narrator

text:
With food to eat and clothes to wear;
    content we are in everything.
speaker: Narrator

text: But people who want to get rich keep toppling into temptation and are trapped by many stupid and harmful desires that plunge them into destruction and ruin.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the love of money is a root of all kinds of evil. Some people, in their eagerness to get rich, have wandered away from the faith and caused themselves a lot of pain.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But you, man of God, must flee from all these things.
    Instead, you must pursue righteousness, godliness, faithfulness,
        love, endurance, and gentleness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Fight the good fight for the faith.
    Keep holding on to eternal life, to which you were called
and about which you gave a good testimony
    in front of many witnesses.
speaker: Narrator

text: Since you are in the presence of God, who gives life to everything, and in the presence of the Messiah Jesus, who gave a good testimony before Pontius Pilate, I solemnly charge you
speaker: Narrator

text: to keep these commands stainlessly and blamelessly until the appearance of our Lord Jesus, the Messiah.
speaker: Narrator

text:
At the right time, he will make him known.
God is the blessed and only Ruler,
    the King of kings
        and Lord of lords.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He alone has endless life
    and lives in inaccessible light.
No one has ever seen him,
    nor can anyone see him.
Honor and eternal power belong to him!
    Amen.
speaker: Narrator

text: Tell those who are rich in this age not to be arrogant and not to place their confidence in anything as uncertain as riches. Instead, let them place their confidence in God, who lavishly provides us with everything for our enjoyment.
speaker: Narrator

text: They are to do good, to be rich in good actions, to be generous, and to share.
speaker: Narrator

text: By doing this they store up a treasure for themselves that is a good foundation for the future, so that they can keep their hold on the life that is real.
speaker: Narrator

text: Timothy, guard what has been entrusted to you. Avoid the pointless discussions and contradictions of what is falsely called knowledge.
speaker: Narrator

text: Although some claim to have it, they have abandoned the faith. May grace be with all of you!
speaker: Narrator
